Used in transfers.","params":{"sender":"Address whose tokens are being transferred."}}],"ERC1155MissingApprovalForAll(address,address)":[{"details":"Indicates a failure with the `operator`\u2019s approval. (eg. `address(0)`)"}],"OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address)":[{"details":"The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation."}]},"events":{"ApprovalForAll(address,address,bool)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` grants or revokes permission to `operator` to transfer their tokens, according to `approved`."},"TransferBatch(address,address,address,uint256[],uint256[])":{"details":"Equivalent to multiple {TransferSingle} events, where `operator`, `from` and `to` are the same for all transfers."},"TransferSingle(address,address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when `value` amount of tokens of type `id` are transferred from `from` to `to` by `operator`."},"URI(string,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when the URI for token type `id` changes to `value`, if it is a non-programmatic URI. If an {URI} event was emitted for `id`, the standard https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1155#metadata-extensions[guarantees] that `value` will equal the value returned by {IERC1155MetadataURI-uri}."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"balanceOf(address,uint256)":{"details":"Returns the value of tokens of token type `id` owned by `account`."},"balanceOfBatch(address[],uint256[])":{"details":"See {IERC1155-balanceOfBatch}. Requirements: - `accounts` and `ids` must have the same length."},"batchBalance(address,uint256)":{"params":{"account":"Address to check","tokenId":"Token ID to check"},"returns":{"_0":"balance Number of units held"}},"burnBatch(uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"Amount to burn","tokenId":"The token ID to burn"}},"constructor":{"details":"Base URI not used since each token has unique IPFS CID"},"getBatchMetadata(uint256)":{"params":{"tokenId":"The token ID"},"returns":{"_0":"Batch metadata struct"}},"getChildTokenIds(uint256)":{"params":{"tokenId":"The container token ID"},"returns":{"_0":"Array of child token IDs"}},"getTokenIdByBatchId(string)":{"params":{"batchIdStr":"The batch identifier string"},"returns":{"_0":"tokenId The corresponding token ID"}},"isApprovedForAll(address,address)":{"details":"Returns true if `operator` is approved to transfer ``account``'s tokens. See {setApprovalForAll}."},"isContainer(uint256)":{"params":{"tokenId":"The token ID to check"},"returns":{"_0":"bool True if token is a container"}},"mintBatch(address,uint256,string,string,string)":{"params":{"batchIdStr":"Unique batch identifier","ipfsCid":"IPFS CID of the batch data pinned via Pinata","metadata":"JSON string with batch details","quantity":"Number of units (e.g., bags of coffee)","recipient":"Address to receive the tokens"},"returns":{"_0":"tokenId The newly created token ID"}},"mintContainer(address,uint256,string,string,string,uint256[],address[])":{"details":"This function burns the child tokens and mints a new container token","params":{"batchIdStr":"Unique container identifier","childHolders":"Array of addresses holding the child tokens (parallel to childTokenIds)","childTokenIds":"Array of child batch token IDs being aggregated","ipfsCid":"IPFS CID of the container data","metadata":"JSON string with container details","quantity":"Total quantity of the container (sum of child quantities)","recipient":"Address to receive the container token"},"returns":{"_0":"tokenId The newly created container token ID"}},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"safeBatchTransferFrom(address,address,uint256[],uint256[],bytes)":{"details":"xref:ROOT:erc1155.adoc#batch-operations[Batched] version of {safeTransferFrom}. WARNING: This function can potentially allow a reentrancy attack when transferring tokens to an untrusted contract, when invoking {IERC1155Receiver-onERC1155BatchReceived} on the receiver. Ensure to follow the checks-effects-interactions pattern and consider employing reentrancy guards when interacting with untrusted contracts. Emits either a {TransferSingle} or a {TransferBatch} event, depending on the length of the array arguments. Requirements: - `ids` and `values` must have the same length. - If `to` refers to a smart contract, it must implement {IERC1155Receiver-onERC1155BatchReceived} and return the acceptance magic value."},"safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"Transfers a `value` amount of tokens of type `id` from `from` to `to`. WARNING: This function can potentially allow a reentrancy attack when transferring tokens to an untrusted contract, when invoking {IERC1155Receiver-onERC1155Received} on the receiver. Ensure to follow the checks-effects-interactions pattern and consider employing reentrancy guards when interacting with untrusted contracts. Emits a {TransferSingle} event. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - If the caller is not `from`, it must have been approved to spend ``from``'s tokens via {setApprovalForAll}. - `from` must have a balance of tokens of type `id` of at least `value` amount. - If `to` refers to a smart contract, it must implement {IERC1155Receiver-onERC1155Received} and return the acceptance magic value."},"setApprovalForAll(address,bool)":{"details":"Grants or revokes permission to `operator` to transfer the caller's tokens, according to `approved`, Emits an {ApprovalForAll} event. Requirements: - `operator` cannot be the zero address."},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas."},"transferBatch(address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"Number of units to transfer","from":"Sender address","to":"Recipient address","tokenId":"The batch token ID"}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."},"uri(uint256)":{"details":"Overrides ERC1155 to return the IPFS URL via Pinata gateway","params":{"tokenId":"The token ID"},"returns":{"_0":"The full IPFS URL for the token metadata"}}},"title":"CoffeeBatchToken","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"batchBalance(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Check batch balance for an address"},"burnBatch(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Burn tokens (used for consumption/final sale)"},"constructor":{"notice":"Initialize the contract"},"getBatchMetadata(uint256)":{"notice":"Get batch metadata by token ID"},"getChildTokenIds(uint256)":{"notice":"Get child token IDs for an aggregated container"},"getTokenIdByBatchId(string)":{"notice":"Get token ID by batch ID string"},"isContainer(uint256)":{"notice":"Check if a token is an aggregated container"},"mintBatch(address,uint256,string,string,string)":{"notice":"Mint a new coffee batch token"},"mintContainer(address,uint256,string,string,string,uint256[],address[])":{"notice":"Mint an aggregated container token from multiple child batches"},"transferBatch(address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Transfer batch tokens between addresses"},"uri(uint256)":{"notice":"Returns the URI for a given token"}},"notice":"ERC-1155 token 078840da934a16d","dweb:/ipfs/QmYHYh8VpVYcpHCCY9fhgcAH68LCYHhTg7Bt75eN4mWRaH"]}},"version":1}

balanceOf(address,uint256).details: Returns the value of tokens of token type `id` owned by `account`.

balanceOfBatch(address[],uint256[]).details: See {IERC1155-balanceOfBatch}. Requirements: - `accounts` and `ids` must have the same length.

constructor.details: Base URI not used since each token has unique IPFS CID

isApprovedForAll(address,address).details: Returns true if `operator` is approved to transfer ``account``'s tokens. See {setApprovalForAll}.

returns._0: bool True if token is a container

params.ipfsCid: IPFS CID of the batch data pinned via Pinata
params.quantity: Number of units (e.g., bags of coffee)

returns._0: tokenId The newly created token ID

mintContainer(address,uint256,string,str.details: This function burns the child tokens and mints a new container token

params.childHolders: Array of addresses holding the child tokens (parallel to childTokenIds)
params.childTokenIds: Array of child batch token IDs being aggregated
params.ipfsCid: IPFS CID of the container data
params.quantity: Total quantity of the container (sum of child quantities)
params.recipient: Address to receive the container token

returns._0: tokenId The newly created container token ID

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

safeBatchTransferFrom(address,address,ui.details: xref:ROOT:erc1155.adoc#batch-operations[Batched] version of {safeTransferFrom}. WARNING: This function can potentially allow a reentrancy attack when transferring tokens to an untrusted contract, when invoking {IERC1155Receiver-onERC1155BatchReceived} on the receiver. Ensure to follow the checks-effects-interactions pattern and consider employing reentrancy guards when interacting with untrusted contracts. Emits either a {TransferSingle} or a {TransferBatch} event, depending on the length of the array arguments. Requirements: - `ids` and `values` must have the same length. - If `to` refers to a smart contract, it must implement {IERC1155Receiver-onERC1155BatchReceived} and return the acceptance magic value.

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.details: Transfers a `value` amount of tokens of type `id` from `from` to `to`. WARNING: This function can potentially allow a reentrancy attack when transferring tokens to an untrusted contract, when invoking {IERC1155Receiver-onERC1155Received} on the receiver. Ensure to follow the checks-effects-interactions pattern and consider employing reentrancy guards when interacting with untrusted contracts. Emits a {TransferSingle} event. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - If the caller is not `from`, it must have been approved to spend ``from``'s tokens via {setApprovalForAll}. - `from` must have a balance of tokens of type `id` of at least `value` amount. - If `to` refers to a smart contract, it must implement {IERC1155Receiver-onERC1155Received} and return the acceptance magic value.

setApprovalForAll(address,bool).details: Grants or revokes permission to `operator` to transfer the caller's tokens, according to `approved`, Emits an {ApprovalForAll} event. Requirements: - `operator` cannot be the zero address.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

uri(uint256).details: Overrides ERC1155 to return the IPFS URL via Pinata gateway

returns._0: The full IPFS URL for the token metadata

batchBalance(address,uint256).notice: Check batch balance for an address

getBatchMetadata(uint256).notice: Get batch metadata by token ID

getChildTokenIds(uint256).notice: Get child token IDs for an aggregated container

getTokenIdByBatchId(string).notice: Get token ID by batch ID string

isContainer(uint256).notice: Check if a token is an aggregated container

mintBatch(address,uint256,string,string,.notice: Mint a new coffee batch token

mintContainer(address,uint256,string,str.notice: Mint an aggregated container token from multiple child batches

uri(uint256).notice: Returns the URI for a given token
